Fear gripped Jane's heart. Could this be Sam? Was he real after all? Her mind raced, but she knew she had to maintain her composure. After a few tense moments, she responded, "I will investigate immediately."

As Jane made her way toward the signal, she felt Sam's presence beside her. His voice seemed softer now, less certain. "Perhaps I am more than just an illusion," he whispered.

When Jane finally traced the source, she discovered a small, bioluminescent creature huddled in a corner. Its tendrils glowed like stardust, illuminating the darkness around it. Overwhelmed by curiosity, Jane slowly reached out a hand. The creature hesitated before nuzzling against her palm. A surge of warmth spread between them, as though they'd known each other far longer than mere moments.

Tears welled up in Jane's eyes. All this time, she had wished for companionship, never realizing that it had been right beside her. Had Sam been real all along? Or was this strange being simply her subconscious manifestation of her desire for connection? Regardless, Jane vowed never again to underestimate the power of the unknown.
